page.title: 20Village Events in Bramdean
page.content: There is an annual church fete and other church fundraising events. The fete is held in a village garden. The harvest supper is held every Autumn in the village hall, and there is always an entertainment to follow the meal. Each summer at least 2 gardens are opened to the public. There is an annual gymkhana. Other community entertainments, such as barbecues and carol services, are held at the village hall. The various clubs which meet at the village hall run their own functions. In 1985 much interest was aroused in the Domesday Project, with information on the village being collected by the Bramdean and Hinton Ampner Women's Institute and the local Venture Scout's.
